runs.comm: loud cheers as Guptill glances the back of length ball fine down the leg side for four. It's a no ball too, free hit coming up
clobbered for six! That was short outside off with room, he cleared his front foot and smashed it on the off side for a massive six!
towards the pads again, deflects it to square leg, straight to the fielder
short of length towards off stump, Guptill defends it back
146kmh, length delivery outside the off stump now, Guptill lets it go
right on target on the off stump on length, head down and Guptill defends it towards mid off
wider outside the off stump, punched off the back foot to point
Baz charges down like a bull, Starc bowls it wide outside off for a wide. Things heating up here
148.6kph, he's not going to stop, he's lofted that with a drive by dancing down the track over the covers for a six!
low and wide full toss, forces it down to third man for one
146.6kph, leans forward and blocks the length delivery outside off
shorter on middle stump, turned away to backward square for one
he doesn't care where the fielders are! Got a full delivery around off stump and whacked it straight down the ground, over Guptill's head to beat long off
charges down, and swishes at the low full toss to get a single to third man
pitched up outside off, Baz slams it over the point boundary this time with a step down the track. SIX runs
overpitched again and Baz clears his front foot to muscle it over the covers now. He's getting some loose deliveries and not letting them go anywhere but to the boundary
yorker this time on middle and leg, he pushes it on the off side as there was no room
147kmh, that was quick, hits him on the arm! The short ball on leg crammed Baz up, he made some room and had absolutely no time to react, and ended up taking it on the arm, very close to the elbow
short of length and angling away, he slices it late from just over off stump to send it flying over and wide of first slip for four. There's only one slip
makes room to pull the short ball on the leg side but only gets an edge onto his body
leans forward towards the ball and lets it go as it angles away from him
too full outside off, driven straight to cover point
down the leg side for a wide now
fullish well outside off, drives it down to mid-off off the front foot
middle stump line for the length delivery, flicked to midwicket

taken at mid off, Guptill's gone! It was pitched up again, Guptill merely chipped it down the ground with a drive, maybe looking to clear mid off, but Cummins went to his right to complete a good catch
bouncer on the leg side and KW ducks under it to let it go
on the pads, worked away off the legs to fine leg for one
another bouncer for KW, he ducks under it again
too full on the pads and KW tucks it fine down the leg side to beat the fine leg fielder easily. Used his wrists there to help it fine
drives the length ball on off but gets an inside edge on the leg side for one
length delivery on the middle stump, driven into the covers
but he comes down the track, no matter what, and crashes the ball by taking it on the full straight down, all along the ground for four. That's NZ's 50 in only five overs, compared to Australia's 5.3
back of length outside off, KW hops back to defend it on off
fullish outside the off stump, driven into the covers for one
that was a chance, but too quick and tough! Baz saw the short ball and pulled it back to Starc's right hand, he stuck it out but could not hold on to it
on off stump now on length, pushed straight to short cover
that's a waist-high full toss, Bazz pulls and gets lucky with an outside edge which goes between the keeper and slip for four
on middle and leg now, helped to the midwicket fielder
calmly comes forward and steers this full delivery past the second slip for a single to third man
wooh! Johnson is intent on targetting that arm but McCullum is not showing any pain here! He swivels and slaps it through backward square leg. One bounce and four.
take that Johnson! If AB can do it, so can Baz. This is almost a hockey scoop, sails deep into the stand over long-off
he is ripping into his mate here! Another one targetted at the arm and another one swatted with utter disdain over the man at short fine
take a bow Baz! He is carrying New Zealand on his broad shoulders.. Reaches his fifty off just 21 deliveries as he digs this yorker out to cover
Kane train appears in no rush at the other end, even when he takes a quick single to cover.. Makes it easily to the other end
back of length delivery on off, the batsman hops on the crease and punches it through the gap at cover. Kane train is off again. No problems whatsoever
but that fielder won't be needed! Cummins has lost this short delivery. That is way down the leg side, way over the batsman's head.. no chance for Haddin to reach it
he arches back to guide this short delivery over the slip fielder but makes no contact, flies away with a lot of pace straight to the keeper
comes out charging down the pitch but misses it, the ball takes the bottom edge and slides to first slip

he gets it off the middle but finds the man at mid-off! End of a superb innings by Baz, played, I am sure, with a badly hurting left hand. He gave himself room and looked to clear this over the off side, but just did not get the elevation. Easy catch for the fielder. But yet again, he has set New Zealand on the road to victory with a massive thrust up the order
thick top edge towards third man! Taylor looks to punch this rising delivery off the back foot but wasn't in control of the shot at all
Kane train waits in the crease and defends the length delivery solidly down the pitch

knocks him over, there goes the off stump! Taylor tried a cross-batted shot for the length delivery just around off, the ball swung in and went right through the gate to rattle the off stump. The players head off for what was supposed to be innings break at this time

middle stump's gone, first ball! Elliott left a big gap between bat and pad for the straight delivery that pitched around off and came in to rattle middle stump, he didn't have much footwork either and pushed only tentatively at the ball. Happens on the first ball
defends the length delivery on the off stump, back to the bowler
back of length on off now, he turns it to midwicket with soft hands and sets off for a quick single
short of length on leg, tucked to short leg off the back foot

searing inswinging yorker on the off stump, looks like he got bat on it while trying to defend but some of the Australian players are appealing for lbw, especially Maxwell at short leg and Haddin. Starc did not look that interested, and it's turned down
angles across the ball from off away from the batsman, Anderson lets it go
slightly fuller outside off and Anderson shoulders arms again
tries to heave the length ball on the leg side but misses it completely! It didn't bounce as much as it went across him on off

there's bounce this time for that short ball, thick edge flies over the slips! Anderson stayed back on his toes for it, it took off from back of length and got the shoulder of the bat. Luckily for him, went over the fielders
presses forward and defends the length ball on the off side
angles it in towards the pads, KW can't get it away while trying to go on his toes, and gets it on the pads
back of length and well outside off, swings away from the batsman as he leaves it
beats him! Good bounce at good pace from back of length outside off, Anderson poked his bat out but the ball moved away from him to miss the edge
closer to off stump on similar length and he defends it back this time
Anderson is looking clueless! This was a beautiful delivery, pitched up outside off, the batsman tried to whip it on the leg side for some reason and missed it completely as it swung away
attempted yorker is a low full toss on middle, clipped to midwicket region for two
short of length and well outside off, pushes it off the back foot to point
angles it in towards the off stump, KW defends it back solidly
he gets room and punches it authoritatively off the back foot, past point for a cracking four! It was short and a bit wide, enough for KW to pounce on it
presses forward and taps this one late to third man for one
fullish on the pads, he tries to clip it away on leg but misses
shorter outside the leg stump, worked off the back foot this time towards midwicket for one
shorterer and wider, forced off the back foot to point
he leans forward, looking to poke at the ball but it's slightly wider and beats him outside off
goes shorter just outside off and Anderson pulls it to midwicket
tries a yorker, but errs down the leg side with a full delivery for a wide
heaves again, misses again! Can't see a reason why he's playing those. This was short of length, but not short enough to be pulled, he tried and missed
full and well outside off, swings away further and it's left alone
angling in now towards off and middle, Anderson defends it down to mid on
fuller just outside off with some outswing, flicked with the wrists to mid on
slightly back of length outside off, KW defends it back to the bowler
touch wider outside the off stump, pushed to point off the back foot
leans forward nicely and drives the outside-off delivery down to mid off
that's too wide outside off and KW steers it with good timing between point and cover point right in the gap. Warner chases from point, puts in the slide at the boundary and saves two
fullish delivery this time, driven down to mid off now
full on middle, flicked away to midwicket where a dive from the fielder stops the ball
bangs in the short ball, Anderson pulls it back in the air and it goes just wide of MJ's left hand, straight down the ground for four

Anderson's carrying a lot of luck with him! This back of length ball was just over middle stump from outside leg, the bat came down really really late, and got an inside edge to beat the keeper for four
middles it this time and gets six! Expected the short ball, got the short ball and smoked it to the midwicket boundary to send it all the way
length delivery outside off and swinging away, left alone easily
pretty straight just outside off, closer to the stumps and he lets it go again
full on middle stump, clipped away towards deep square leg and they come back for the second in time
gives him room and KW drives it uppishly and dangerously over short cover and wide of point for a four
leans forward for a classical cover drive straight to mid off
shuffles across early and tucks the ball from outside off past midwicket for one
yorker on the off stump, Anderson stays back and digs it out on the off side
slogs the length delivery from leg to the leg side, doesn't middle it but puts it in the gap for two
too full and wide, Anderson goes down on a knee and drives it in the air, well over the covers for three
back of length swinging away from well outside off, left alone
closer to the off stump now, Anderson defends it back off the back foot
148kph, quick and on length outside off, leaves the outswinger alone
back of length now just outside off, he rocks back and defends solidly
nearly a yorker on the middle stump, driven down to mid on
angling in this time, goes off the pad to the off side
KW wants to get done with it, went onto the back foot early and heaved it to the right of midwicket for four
slightly wide outside the off stump now, he lets it go
130kph, drives the fullish delivery straight down to mid off
too much room on offer, it's short too, and KW swats it away over the covers while going on his toes for another four
he's in fine touch, got a full delivery this time around off and drove it between mid on and midwicket in the gap
leans forward nicely and taps the length delivery late to third man for one
fullish outside off, turned down to mid on by closing the face of the bat
back of length on the leg stump, helped down to fine leg for one
fuller and wider outside off with outswing, left alone
on middle stump, Anderson drives it to the left of mid on but no time for a run
tries to clip the full delivery on the pads to the leg side but takes it on the pad

loud appeal for lbw as Anderson misses again, turned down and Australia review it. The full delivery pitched on middle but hit him in front of leg and looks like it was going going down leg. HawkEye says it's just clipping, so umpire's call, so stays not out
outside the leg stump and it's worked to deep square leg for one
fullish outside off, turned with the wrists to mid on
bit of flight outside off, slices it off the back foot to cover point

he slogs and he gives a catch! It was a length delivery just outside off, Anderson went down on a knee for the slog sweep and slammed it straight to mid on where Cummins took a good, low catch. They are checking for the catch now, Anderson waiting at the boundary. Cummins was down on his knees as the ball was dipping on him, replays show a part of the ball was out of his hands and they aren't clear enough to say if the ball hit the ground for sure or not. Given out finally, Anderson walks back again
goes back for the slight turn and pushes it back
that's a beautiful, lofted, straight drive for six, what a way to get off the mark! He saw it was pitched up, didn't have to move much and lofted it straight down the ground over the long on boundary
reaches out for it and taps it late to third man for one
draws a thick outside edge off Ronchi's bat with the angled delivery and gully fields it
strays down the leg side past the pads and it's a wide
pushes the length delivery outside the off stump into the covers
full and swinging in towards off, chipped uppishly towards midwicket. The fielder sent in a flat throw and nearly got Maxwell at short leg on the way
in the block hole well outside off, steered to gully

peach of a delivery from Starc and that deserves a wicket! Nasty bouncer around middle stump, it was quick, and by the time Ronchi could sway out of the line by bending back like Keanu Reaves, the ball took some glove on the way
too full, too straight and it's clipped over the midwicket fielder in the gap for two
incoming from outside off, runs it down to third man for one
too short and wide, Vettori even shuffled across and it's a wide
short ball on the leg side, swatted along the ground a bit wide of deep fine leg and he comes back for the second
goes across again, that was a close one as Vettori missed the pull and it went just over the stumps, coming in from the leg side
wicket off a full toss, chipped straight to mid on! Innocuous and low full toss on the pads, Vettori hangs his head down after handing a straightforward catch to mid on
swing and a miss! Length delivery just outside off, teasing line, Milne swung his bat for a drive and nearly edged it
full and around off, KW digs it out back to the bowler
taps the full delivery from off with soft hands down to mid off and calls for a single
Starc pumps the air, he's hit the stumps! Full delivery on middle, Milne exposed his stumps a bit, went for the drive and missed it completely
GONE, Starc's on fire! He knows how to bowl those yorkers, doesn't he! Targets the off stump, Southee tries to put it away on the leg side but it's too quick at 150kmh and rattles the stumps
straight delivery on middle and leg, Boult defends it back carefully after covering his stumps
oh, this is too wide outside off and Boult leaves it easily

KW has done it, slams a six straight down the ground! Made room by exposing all his stumps, got a full delivery in the groove and tonked it over long on. Mid on was in for some reason and he pumped the air even before the ball reached the boundary. Learn from this man how to perform under pressure
